job_title: Senior Human Resources Advisor in London, England
Customer Service Advisor in Leicester, England
pros: Work satisfaction is good, good colleagues, helpful
cons: Short staffed sometimes and a bit stressful

review_title: Very supportive organisation even during Covid19
pros: I have now been been working for Advance for 9 months and they have been very supportive in regards to my disability during Covid19. My team is making sure they keep in touch even though I am WFH. They have made adjustments that allowed me to work throughout and even progress my career. I am now part of a working group for Equality , Diversity and Inclusion and I am proud to say Advance is a Disability Confident leader, putting the scheme into practise every day. During lockdown they offered a lot of support for the mental health of their staff and are re-thinking the status quo on working in offices. I would definitely recommend working for Advance!
cons: The pay is average but company perks are great.

review_title: A good company that lost its way
pros: Staff want to make a difference. Action-oriented approach to providing solutions to some of the most vulnerable and marginalized adults in the UK. Great cause, supported by a number of truly exceptional staff.
cons:
The tension between its not-for-profit status and the need to be businesslike causes a lot of friction. Some antiquated systems. Company almost brought to its knees through a period of poor leadership, where a visionary CEO was succeeded by an inadequate one. 
A lot of feudal attitudes among staff who don't see the bigger picture. Staff not always treated well, particularly where their mental health and wellbeing is concerned.

pros: Good charitable company who look after their customers well.  Lovely staff to work with.
cons: Don't look after their staff very well with salaries and reimbursements for extra responsibilities.  Have a high turn over of staff, and therefore incur extra costs with having to recruit and retrain new staff all the time.  Staff would be happier if they were treated with respect and rewards for their commitment, flexibility and hard work.
